Reviews.Title: “Indian Point Tribesman Resort--Great family cabins”
Reviews.Author: trvlover_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort years ago and it seemed to need a face-lift. We stayed again this past Labor Day weekend and were pleasantly surprised. 7 families stayed in the Timber Oaks cabins, we had a 6 bedroom and a 4 bedroom. These new cabins were really nice, large bedrooms each with a private bath. The living and kitchen areas were large, the kitchen table was huge and allowed most of us to sit down and eat together. There was also a nice table set outside on the covered patio. These cabins were clean and well equipped for large family groups. This is a great location, easy lake access and easy access into Branson. This area is on the same lake road as Silver Dollar City, so you can avoid a lot of traffic getting into the park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tribesman in July for 5 days and it was wonderful. It was our first time to Table Rock and we loved every minute of it. Our kids just loved the pool right outside our "house". We went on many walks also and rented a pontoon boat and tube which was the highlight of the trip. The owners were very helpful and nice. We stayed in timber top area, it was so quiet and clean. Our kids ages 14, 11, and 5 didn't want to leave. I can't say enough about how great this resort is. So much fun and relaxing for us parents! We will stay here again in future visits to Table Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: green1010_0
Reviews.Content: Our tribe has been blessed to be able to stay at the Tribesman for 4 years now. When we arrive it's better than coming home. They treat us like royalty. Even the rain and hot weather is tolerable when we are in this part of God's country. It's not the weather we come for it's the people and the hospitality. The cabins we stay in are 3 bedrooms or 5 bedrooms depending on how many of the family members go. The 5 bedroom cabins even have a washer and dryer. We've rented pontoon boats,golf carts,bought worms pop, shirts and other essentials. One night we even build a camp fire in the fire ring just to set and tell stories and fix s'mores. the fact that we didn't catch many fish didn't dampen our spirit's. There were to many other things to do. One year we hunted and found Geronimo. Later the next year we found old McGeezer. Even when we all scattered to do different things we would all meet on the patio to cool down and make plans and enjoy the company of other Tribesman's guest and have free snacks together in the afternoon. This whole experience has made a million memories for us. Thanks to to the staff Arno 2nd,Arno 3rd,Gayle,James and Heide and all the other staff members. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: WallyDog
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our family vacation at Tribesman. We stayed in a Timber Trace unit. It was spacious and clean and the appliances were new-ish and in working condition. The furnishings and decorations were very, very dated but I wasn't expecting the Ritz. The pool near our unit could use a good scrubbing but it was adequate. Our toddler appreciated the zero entry pool and everyone loved swimming off the dock. One note: the speed limit on Indian Point Rd drops from 40 mph to 20 mph shortly before you turn into Tribesman. We got pulled over but luckily we were let off with just a warning. Be sure to slow down and pay attention to the speed limit signs!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: DenimDaisy
Reviews.Content: Your enjoyment of the Tribesman Resort will greatly depend on what is important to you. Some of the negative reviews were surprising to me and I believe a result of consumers not fully informing themselves or being out of touch with what they truly want. We have visited Tribesman for the past two years staying in Timber Trace last year and Timber Top this year. I absolutely loved Timber Top!! PROS: Units have been very clean; no bugs, remnants of prior guests, or odors. Units have had great proximity to a pool and laundry Staff was quite accommodating when we needed something Boat rental was easy and flexible (one of our party was late and rental time didn't start until we actually began boating) There were ample towels available and an easy way to exchange them daily There are a variety of things available so that a large family with differing interests can all enjoy Proximity to Silver Dollar City and Branson attractions was wonderful. THINGS TO BE AWARE OF: Technology and decorations are not state-of-art. These are simple country cottage-like units. For us, this was perfect. We were able to enjoy the Olympics on the tv provided in the evening and catch the news. Otherwise, we enjoyed the family time and timeless activities such as fishing, boating, swimming, grilling, and visiting local attractions. Accommodations are sufficient for nurturing a family. If you are looking for luxurious bedding and expensive wall art, this won't be a good choice. But if you are interested in a great view of wooded areas, quick and friendly service, and awesome access to the lake, the environment is fitting.

Reviews.Title: “Clean affordable resort on Indian Point”
Reviews.Author: pianogirl650
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying if you want a 4-star hotel, go elsewhere. The Tribesman Resort is more, well, rustic in nature. Our goal is always to find someplace clean to sleep (that doesn't break the bank), as we are hardly ever in our room when we vacation. We stayed in the Timber Ridge section in a 2-bedroom apartment. Our room was definitely dated, with older furnishings & furniture - but it was spic and span clean. Even with food left out on the kitchen counters and table, I never saw one bug the entire time we were there. PROS: Roomy kitchen/living room area, full kitchen with full-size refrigerator, appliances all in working order, comfortable beds, hot shower with good water pressure. CONS: Wall unit A/C in the living area meant that the bedroom doors had to stay open in order to stay cool. Small vanity in the bathroom and no other available shelf space made it tough for 4 people to find a place for their toiletries. One of the highlights of the resort was the swimdock. We made it down there two times & the kids had a ball jumping off the dock and swimming around in the cove. We don't own a boat & didn't rent anything while we were there. We swam in one of the pools & used the hot tub while we were there. The hot tub was clean & well-maintained. I assume the pool was too, but we swam right after a storm so naturally there was a lot of debris floating around. I also liked the on-site laundry room, with free use of washer & dryer. We were lucky enough to be within easy walking distance of it. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Don't be afraid of the deposit that you have to mail in ahead of time; we got a refund check back in the mail within about a week of our departure. Overall, we really liked the place and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure and stay in a newer house...”
Reviews.Author: Russell O
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Tribesman over the 4th of July, 2012. We reserved a house in a timber top area - dutch house (two bdrm). When we checked in, we were very disappointed. The house smelled strongly of must and mildew - old carpet, old furnitrue, old beds, old everything. Cozy, but reminded me of cabins in Minnesota in the 60's. The problem was smells like this give my wife migraines. The rest of our extended family were in one of the new 6 bedroom houses -very nice. So we asked if we had any options for another similar small cabin/house - without the smell (and hopefully better all around). The owners were very accomodating and moved us into a 5 bedroom unit on the other side of the property, much better, as no smaller units were available. They also did not charge us any additional fees, which was very considerate. The pools near the newer houses are also better. The property is gravel lanes and dusty. The TVs in both the units we were in were old, not compatible with the new game systems that inevitably are a part of today's family trips. They gave us two 'adaptors', neither worked, and they didn't know how to hook them up. In the new 6 bdrm units where other family members were, the TV's were flatscreens and compatible with gaming systems.

Reviews.Title: “tribesmen returners”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to tribesmen 30+ years and last year it was three generations from our family there . We are always treated friendly and our rooms are always fine . If something would go wrong it would be corrected and I love the way the cater to family values I would never stay anywhere else. Jackie Messenger

Reviews.Title: “Tribesman resort on Flat Rock Lake MO”
Reviews.Author: LEE O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tribesman as part of a Family reunion with our OH relatives. The multi-room units were close together for easy visiting and group meals. We had a nice clean 20x40 pool only 70ft from our back door. It came with a sloped end to walk in, numerous chairs, tables, and loungers, and was 6ft at the deep end with lazy fountain splasing into the deep end..There were enough trees to offer good shade in the 105F tem Our AC worked hard but kept both floor comfortable during the record breaking 100-106F heat the last week of June 3012... The main great room was adequate for a family meal with a regular kitchen and washer dryer combind unit...The entry had a spiral staircase inside the unti and outside stairs for late nite entry & suitcase delivery.. Every Tuesday they serve vanilla ice cream at the main lodge from 6-7pm. It's a plain but well shaded & clean lodge area..This is a lower cost but comfortable place to stay but done' expect fancy towels, soap r shampoo_just a lot of useful room and amenities for your dollars. They were working on the WIFI when we were there but it still worked adequately...We'll be back in 2014 for the next reunion...

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kari W
Reviews.Content: whole family loved every minute. great swimming and fishing. 5 swimming pools! this resort is right on table rock lake! the kids caught alot of blue gill, and my husband caught alot of bass. my personal favorite is swimming off of the dock in the lake. we spent time in branson, but did not need to because the resort was so wonderful. we highly recommend tribesman resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort at Table Rock”
Reviews.Author: rizjag
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the 6 bedroom, 6 bath houses....plenty of room for our large family. We have been going to this resort for 30 years and are never disappointed with the fun, level of service, good times we have there.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort on Table Rock Lake”
Reviews.Author: goinallover
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long family vacation at Tribesman Resort. We stayed in one of the 3 bed Timber Glen units. I can't say enough good things about this resort. The property is immaculately cleaned and maintained. The owners obviously take great pride in their resort and it shows. There is so much to do at the resort you could spend a week and never leave the premises. The staff is awesome with their great attitudes and their willingness to give advice about restaurants and activities. Had a fabulous vacation and we plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “One of top family vacations!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at one of the Timber Oak houses. It was very accommodating. The house was clean and free of clutter and there was usable storage. We loved the 4 bed/4 bath as each of our families could have their own! The water was hot when you needed it to be - even with several showers being taken - and it was soft yet didn't taste funny. We stayed on a weekend when their weren't a lot of other guests so we didn't have to share the pool in our backyard, but we also toured to see the rest of the pools. Renting the boats were easy. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The boats were clean and life jackets were in good condition also. We definitely would come back again! Next time we will know to bring a few extra kitchen items, like scissors, electric mixer, and a good non-stick skillet. And all the fish were hiding!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot - our grandkids LOVED it”
Reviews.Author: Pat G
Reviews.Content: We took our two oldest grandchildren to Silver Dollar City in Branson. I actually found out about The Tribesman Resort on TripAdvisor.com and chose it because of its good reviews. It turned out that it wasn't exactly what I expected, but we still loved it and had a great time. Upon check in, we were greeted very warmly and given an overview of what all there was to do. Our room was divided into a lving room/kitchenette area and a bedroom. When we first walked in, there was a distinct scent of bleach, but not overwhelming. I actually was glad to know things were disinfected. The accommodations were comfortable. We had a big window unit air conditioner, which I loved. It blew really good, cold air and drowned out any noise from outside. There was playground equipment for the kids, an indoor pool and an outdoor pool, the lake, activities, free laundry facilities, ducks -- I could go on. We could have had a great time even if we'd never left the property. There was a little shopping are within easy walking distance. We were just about three miles from the entrance to Silver Dollar City which was great. One of our very favorite things about this place was the fireflies. There were thousands of them flying around in the bushes outside our room. I've never seen anything like it before. Our grandkids still talk about what a great time we had here. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: Gussy58
Reviews.Content: We found the Tribesman Resort on line and reserved Labor Day and the next two days for a family vacation with our girls, their husbands and our two 2 year old grandsons. You never know what to expect when finding places on line but we can't say enough about the Tribesman. We stayed in the newer section with the 4 bedroom, 4 bath. It was awesome.....plenty of room for everyone to find their own space. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We plan to make this an annual event!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: After reading some previous reviews, I was a little cautious about going to this resort with the mold concerns. We stayed over Labor Day weekend and had an absolute blast. We stayed in the newer section and the pool was right next to our house. The walk to the lake/dock was not too far. Workers were friendly and helpful. Our DVD player would not hook up to the TV although we were told that it would before we arrived. However, cable was clear and available for evening use for the children. Dishes and cleaning supplies were available and appropriate. I'm ready to go back again next year. It's so close to SDC and Branson Strip. The prices were very affordable and everyone enjoyed their stay. I highly recommend this resort for families who like to remain active with nature, fishing, boating, children activities, swimming, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Jo C
Reviews.Content: Second time to have family vacation here. Stay in their new 4 bedroom 4 bath cabins! They were perfect, even washer & dryer with large dining area so all could sit down for dinner. Very quiet, clean and as always staff was friendly and helpful. Good boating available, fishing, swimming dock and lots of trees with, small restaurant & market nearby - just down the road from Silver Dollar City and close into Branson for shows and other activities. Our family of 16 (stayed in 2 cabins) range in age from 3 to 81 and it met all our needs! Definately will be going back for a 3rd visit hopefully real soon - so relaxing First visit we were in the cabins in "Timber Top" and this time "Timber Oaks"

Reviews.Title: “Timbertops should be razed!”
Reviews.Author: lakebrain
Reviews.Content: The Timbertop accommodations should be torn down. They are very old, smell like mold , anyone with breathing problems would have a hard time. The parking for these accommodations is very limited and difficult to access. They have newer places to rent,but they are ,of course the first to go. The resort should not rent the timbertops out to anyone, at over $200.00 a night should have gone to a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good customer service”
Reviews.Author: gmatofour
Reviews.Content: We called the office soon after arriving with a question about the air conditioning; within 5 minutes one of the owners was over to inspect it and measured the air output with his guage. It was working properly; we had just let the cool air escape as we were moving things in. The point is-- he was there within 5 minutes to check!!! We asked for some fans and they quickly brought over some fans to make us more comfortable. We rented one of the pontoon boats but our party wasn't ready to go at the assigned time; our family arrived a half hour late. That was not a big deal to the owner; they just started our 2 hour time period when everyone was ready to go. I don't think many places would be that accomodating. There aren't a lot of "rules" for the property; they want everyone to have a good time. This is truly a family oriented resort. Our 4 bedroom unit was clean and sufficiently furnished. The mattresses were firm and in very good condition-- no sags in the middle; they just weren't as comfortable as what we have at home

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: runnrgirl
Reviews.Content: I checked reviews for this place before booking, and I trusted them. But..... Egads!! Upon opening the door to our condo, we were met with a foul, musty smell. I discovered that the complex was built into the side of a hill-hence the "basement" smell. It was so bad that my mother had an asthma attack and had to return home. I would have immediately asked for my money back, but I had 4 college kids with me, and they did not want to leave. Also, the only large burner on the stove did not work, and I killed a roach and wire worm. The beds were also old and very hard. I was never so glad to leave a place. The odor was sooooo intense, that when we arrived back home, our clothes reeked of that place. This is the only review I have ever written. I am very busy, but I just wanted to warn others. I would ask how old the building is and if it is built partially underground before I reserved. My morning runs allowed me to view the whole complex, and it all appeared run down and creepy. I will be staying in town at Clarion or Grand Victorian. That would not have been much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wilma729
Reviews.Content: Close family and family friends enjoyed this lovely resort last weekend! We had plenty of sleeping space and air conditioning and lots of grilling time, all at a great price! The apartments were great, the pools were close and clean and the hot tub was soothing! We rented a pontoon boat from the resort for some lake fun and the rental process was so easy and informative and accomodating (compared to the public marina)! There was even a c-store close by for ice and such. The website may advertise a minimum night stay, but by calling the office, they were able to work with us, which caused us to want to stay longer (and we met the minimum night stay afterall). Tribesman was worth the visit and will be our choice each time we return!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time except for...”
Reviews.Author: MyLittleT
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to vacation with family. Only a few feet from Table Rock lake. Dock fishing, Boat rentals, tubes, ski's etc. And the lake was beautiful. The cabin was old but clean. Other than the beds (rock hard) it was a great place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Sit back, relax and get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: dkrug10042
Reviews.Content: What a great weekend we had, with friends and family. Where can you go that the owner/operator is more excited at check in about making sure you know how to fish, than anything else. We had no need to meet our family as they arrived throughout the afternoon and evening. The office at the resort, made sure that family had a key and directions to the cabin, so that those of us who arrived early could begin to enjoy. There are several pools on site, one of which is indoors. Came in perfect during a short rain on Friday afternoon. The resort has so many ammenities to offer during your stay. From boat rentals, paddle boats, canoes, golf carts etc... The staff is very accomodating and ready to assist you anyway they can. This may not be the ritz but the service and attention is excellent. Besides the price is very moderate and not just the rooms. If you are looking for someplace to relax and spend some time with friends or family then this is the place. Don't be the one who says that at this price it just can't be that good. If you do you will miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, welcoming and very family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: MadScrapperMom
Reviews.Content: This was our tenth stay at Tribesman Resort and we consider it our home away from home. We enjoy staying on the lake and near Silver Dollar City so Tribesman fits our needs very well. The accommodations are basic but very clean and comfortable and for this trip we stayed in the Timber Ridge 2 bedroom/1 bath apartments. Our family enjoyed a free golf cart rental that allowed us a new and fun way to explore Indian Point one afternoon. What a treat! Our daughter also likes the indoor pool which is open year round. Free WiFi is now throughout the resort. Can't wait till we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: fencepost
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a five night stay at the Tribesman Resort for a family reunion. Check in was quick and pleasant. We had asked for and received a two bedroom/one bath in the Timber Ridge area. Had we known how dated this unit was, we would have reserved a different unit. One plus was that we were centrally located to everything for the most part. A down side was that the only pool close was an indoor pool which we don't care for. Our had dim ceiling lighting in all rooms but each room did have a lamp. The condo was clean, I felt okay about walking around barefoot. The bathroom was small. The shower was the pits, just about 12 little holes for the water to come out of. Someone with thick or long hair would have trouble getting their hair clean. The water pressure was not good coming out of the sink faucet. The window in the bathroom looked like it had not been cleaned in awhile. The same went for the windows in the bedrooms. By the end of the week, the tile grout on the floor was wet. It wasn't near the tub or toilet so there must be a leak somewhere. My husband's a plumber so he agrees with my diagnosis. The kitchen area is small. I didn't cook any meals but there were adequate utensils to do so. The bedrooms each had a dresser and one end table. The closets had no doors which was okay. But the shelves and hangers needed dusting badly. Also, there was quite a bit of noise generated by the air conditioning unit (window), dehumidifier and fans. Each bedroom had a fan in the wall to pull cool air in from the living area. All the noise did not promote good sleeping. And by the end of the week, the dry towels and bedspreads felt moist, so the dehumidifier apparently wasn't working real well. The grounds are well kept. Housekeeping comes around each day to pick up soiled towels and replace with new ones. You place your soiled ones out on the porch in a basket before 10 am. They also have a check list for you to fill out in case you need more things like toilet paper, paper towels, etc. We only had one issue with housekeeping. One day they did not pick up our dirty towels (we didn't put towels out every day). I went up to the office about 4:30 pm and asked if they were done for the day. When I was told that they were, I said that our towels had not been picked up and they had been out on the porch since before 9:00 am. There were three people behind the desk. One of them said "If you will go back and get them, we'll exchange them for you". Now I was on my way to our big reunion dinner, it was hot outside and I was not about to walk all the way back. Another one of them told me to walk over to housekeeping and get clean towels. Neither of those responses set real well with me. The third person must have picked up on this because she immediately called housekeeping and told them what I said. I found new towels when I returned to our unit. My husband said that workers had been back and forth all day past our unit and no one had bothered to pick up our towels until I said something about it. This last week was so hot there that we did not get out much and walk around the resort. Our children are grown so we did not participate in the children's activities that they have. We did get to see the newer, larger four bedroom/four bathroom homes. Four of them were rented by various family groups at our reunion. They are very nice and spacious. There was two pools accessible from that group of accomodations. We drove around to look at the outside of the other units. They all appeared full so the Tribesman is apparently satisfying a number of people. Would I stay there again? Only if I could have an updated unit. Would I recommend this place to other people? Yes, but I would tell them to be very careful on the unit/area that they requested.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Family friendly fun spot we could have found!”
Reviews.Author: momto5anahubby
Reviews.Content: We reserved a week and would have loved to have stayed for two! We actually extended our stay. Everyone was friendly, helpful and treated us like part of the family. It was hot outside but the AC was cold and there was plenty of shade. We loved the indoor pool, it provided a nice break from the sun. The kids activities are wonderful and helped to keep our kiddos busy, they finally found Geronimo! Great dock area, nice cove! Loved our time and will go back again and again! Great location, close to SDC and not to far to the Branson strip.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW”
Reviews.Author: travelsassy
Reviews.Content: WOW what a great place. Staff very nice and helpful. Lake is beautiful. Kids loved being on the dock and feeding all the fish, turtles, ducks and geese. Pools are very nice.Out of all the hussle and bussle of Branson but still close enough to go in and watch a show or do some shopping. The only thing is that the room decor needs to be updated a bit.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - DANGEROUS”
Reviews.Author: berkenbile
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 2 children for our vacation. We left after staying only 2 days. 1. Water strongly smells like sewage. The hotel is on a penisula of a lake so I suspect it uses well water. The problem is it is within a stones throw of the sewage dumping station for a large RV campground. The water is obviously contaminated. 2. MOLD - there was a strong smell of MOLD and dampness in our bedroom which looked like a three season room that had been converted. 3. Rude - there was a older man that was very rude to me. So much so that his younger coworder spoke up finally and said - do not mind him he gets punchy sometimes. 4. POOL - Do you remember the pool scene in the first vacation movie. They could have shot the scene at this place. 5. Reviews wrong - I suspect many of the positive reviews are put in by staff. This resort has more reviews than other larger resorts in the area - and the reviews are a bit to positive. We are low maintenance people but with the mold and water that smelled like sewage it was to much of a risk for us we left and stayed at the comfort inn in branson for our safety and just lost the money. I hope this saves you the pain we went through. We did have fun in branson but would never stay at the tribesman again even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Our6
Reviews.Content: My family spent Easter weekend at the Tribesman Resort. We were traveling with another family and shared a cottage in the Timber Oaks section of the resort. The home easily accommodated two families with two master bedrooms downstairs and two large bedrooms up. Everyone had their own bathroom, which is always a plus. Our kids were kept busy -they swam in the indoor pool (which was warm!), rented metal detectors (for 50 cents) and hunted for treasures, completed a scavenger hunt, did a little fishing, and were visited by the "resort bunny" the night before Easter who left chocolates for everyone. The spring special included a free 2 hour rental of a pontoon boat which we took advantage of - and had a great time touring Table Rock Lake. All of the employees were very helpful and seemed to go out of their way to make our stay easy and stress-free. They were very pleasant and had a "laid-back" attitude which was much appreciated. I think we've found our new Branson vacation spot. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Wonderful Time At Tribesman”
Reviews.Author: xdeeannx
Reviews.Content: My family and I were planning a vacation to Branson. We wanted a resort with a pool because of the young kids that would be with us. After looking at ALOT of resorts in the Branson area, Tribesman caught our attention. One, because of the value of our stay for 4 nights. It was a very reasonable rate compared to others. Two, the activities that Tribesman has for children were amazing. Our little one loved doing a different activity every day. We all enjoyed the Ice Cream Social night, yummy!! Upon arriving at Tribesman, I admit I was a bit sceptical, because it was such a great rate and the many amenities they offer for their guests. We were greeted at check-in by a very friendly and accomidating staff. When we got to our room, it was very nice. Very clean and was actually nicer than I had planned on. The only complaint I have of the room, was the water. When you used the water in the kitchen sink or the bathroom to take a shower, the water had a rusty, metallic smell to it. Other than that I was very impressed by this resort. We had reservations at tribesman for 4 nights and on our last night we had such a good time, we stayed another night. When we went to the office to book another night,the staff was more than courteous to us. My whole family had an absolutely wonderful time at this resort. And we are actually planing another vacation there this summer. Would recommend this resort to anyone. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value, and all the little details make life easy.”
Reviews.Author: wesbri
Reviews.Content: 12 people representing 3 generations of our family spent Christmas weekend there. With so many people, including 6 kids 6 yrs or younger, it could have been a mess. But the cabin was perfectly designed to accomodate us. The bedrooms and living areas were very spacious, an extra large dining table seated us all, and most importantly the kitchen was a real kitchen with EVERYTHING needed to store, prep, cook, and serve 3 days of meals, including a traditional Christmas feast. Our stay was extremely cold, but the cabin and every room was toasty warm. We rarely used the downstairs fireplace/heater and even cracked open a window when cooking. Also, our unit had a full size washer and drying located in the cabin...very useful when little ones are involved. Plenty of towels were provided for the kitchen and 4 baths, and there was even a large play area upstairs for the kids. We didn't use the upstairs or downstairs deck, or the hot tub and pool just steps away because of the weather, but the indoor pool was well kept and really enjoyed by the kids. In summary, it isn't a luxury resort but it is very clean and well kept with everything needed for a family to have a comfortable stay. We look forward to coming back for a warm weather vacation.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: KabobArky
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, away from all the crowds. Beautiful condo, fully furnished. Great bedrooms with nice beds. We were there for Christmas and they had steaks with all the trimmings left in our frig for us. Wonderful people to work with. This was our first time at Tribesman Resort. We will be returning for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for 3 kids, 6 adults!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails2YALL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights with our children, grandchildren & brother & s-i-l. We all had plenty of room, clean accommodations, & choice of swimming pools. We didn't have time to enjoy all the resort offered. The towel exchange each day was very convenient. We also benfited from the resort"s "2 days for the price of 1" SDC tickets. We all enjoyed the frequent deer sightings. It's a great, convenient, family place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place located on Tablerock Lake, just 3 miles from Silver Dollar City, for famlies to stay”
Reviews.Author: thankfulmomof3
Reviews.Content: We arrived here for our very first time late on a Sunday afternoon after an eight hour drive. As I was checking us in at the front office, I mentioned to the young woman that was helping me, that we were planning on staying at the Horizon's vacation resort by Marriott, but then decided to come here after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and AAA.com and that it was our first time staying her. She didn't say a whole lot and she looked annoyed, like she'd heard my story before and when she was giving me directions she was a bit curt and short. She definitley didn't impress me. So we ended up being in a small building just down the road from the office. We were located in apartment # 3. It looked very cute from the outside,as it had a lot of nice mature shade trees, a nice patio set where you could eat outside and a nice charcoal grill. Our building was also located right across from the indoor pool and one of the hot tubs. We were also next door to the customer laundry. When we got inside it was also decent looking, but UGH, the smell when we first opened the door was like a stale, moldy musty smell. That smell never did go away during the three nights/ two days that we were there. The apartment had two nice sized bedrooms, a small bathroom, a decent kitchen that included a full sized refridgerator, dishwasher, stove, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. They also had all of the utensils and pots, pans, dishes and glasses. The apartment also had a nice little dining area and living area. While there was a small store located on the resort grounds, we chose to drive ten minutes to Branson West, to the Super Wal-Mart to stock up on some groceries, that we hadn't already brought with us. That worked out well because we only ended up eating out twice while we were in Branson (once at the Mill all you can eat BBQ buffet at Silver Dollar City and that was DELICIOUS and a great value too because our two kids who are under 4 ate for free) and our kids enjoyed cooking out and having breakfast in our apartment. I do have to say though that when I called to make my reservation I had asked them if ALL of their units had central air and the person on the phone assured me that they did. Well our unit consisted of a wall type of air conditioner and if you dared shut the bedroom doors, you couldn't feel a bit of the cool air. So I think the central air thing was a bit misleading because that wasn't central air. I also didn't like the fact that the only ceiling fan was located in the living room above the couch. They need to install one in each bedroom above the beds, as those would work well at helping to keep the bedrooms cool. As for the five pools, there is one indoor, that came in handy the one day that it rained in the afternoon and four outdoor pools. The outdoor pools were small and not very clean. They had leaves and small bugs and feathers floating in them. They are also spread out all over the resort, so unless you're willing to shell out at least $35 to rent a golf cart to get around the resort, you will be doing quite a bit of walking to get to the different pools. I would have liked to seen more kid friendly water activities, especially for small children. Now as for the "playgrounds" that they claim to have, that's a different story. Those area joke. The playgrounds consist of a couple of different climbing structures located throughout the resort. There is one that looks like an old stagecoach, but is VERY rickety (probably because it;s at least 15 years old) that I wouldn't let my kids play on, because it appeared very unsafe. Also at this same spot are two horses that you're SUPPOSED to be able to rock on, well one was completley broke and the other one looked like it could come off it's spring at any time. So the playground claim is very misleading. I do not think that Tribesman should be advertising that they have a playground unless they're willing to invest in some new, safer equipment that includes swings and slides. The toyroom is also another joke. It is located in a building behind the main office. I had read an earlier review on here, where a person said that it smelled so musty and mildewey in there. Well I wanted to see for myself and let me tell you, that person wasn't kidding. When you opened the door to the toyroom it smelled like someone's old basement. The room was also very messy and disorganized and the toys didn't appear very clean. On a shelf in the room too were piles of yellowing Polaroid photographs from at least 15 years ago showing people at the resort doing various activties. That room really felt dated and dirty and gave me the creeps, so needless to say we didn't spend anytime there, We did pass the Stillwaters Family Resort on our way to Tribesman and it did look VERY nice, but a bit pricey for us at $299 per night during the summer. The resort also does provide towels for you to use while in your room, you have to bring your own for the pools and hot tubs and they will exchange your towels for clean ones, if you leave your dirty ones in the laundry basket that they provide, outisde the door in the morning. Our kids also enjoyed the small pirate trinkets that they received on Monday for Captain Kids day. Over all the resort was so-so. I was so glad that we decided to stay far away from the traffic and congestion headaches of Branson and Tablerock lake is beautiful. It was also very handy that it was just three miles from Silver Dollar City. The man who checked us out was also much better than the woman who checked us in. He was very nice and sincere. So if you're looking for a place that is a bit dated, but a decent price and is away from it all and is pretty family friendly, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lanelson1964
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this resort and were very pleased. It was every thing we expected and more. They let us come early to escape a bad Hotel. We were in the Timber Trace cottage on the cove, we loved it, nice view of the lake, cute, clean and quiet just what we wanted. Some areas were to bussy for us. Thats why we chose the cottage. We loved watching the Deer every day and night .The pools were wonderful and very clean. We rented one of their pontoon boats and it was also nice. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “A TERRIFIC, relaxing vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: spunkysam
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my daughter and 4 of my grandsons ages 8-14 and we all had a marvelous time. We stayed in cabin #32 (Swiss House) and it was perfect with the boys sharing the upper level and us having the lower level. The cabin is very modern but once you step outside you are in the "country" and the hosts make everyone feel at home. There are numerous activities for the kids and the adults, fishing, shuffleboard, tetherball, metal detectors available to use, numerous swimming pools and hot tubs and peddleboats too. One evening the electricity was out and we roasted marshmallows over the grill outside and played cards by flashlight. The boys can't wait to return next year!! Everyone at the resort was extremely friendly and accomodating to whatever we needed. I would give it an A++. Kay Laatt, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Tribesman is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: tnrppd3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another stay at Tribesman Resort. We had the time of our lives. If you are looking for a place to get away from it all and enjoy yourselves then this is the place for you. My family and I (wife and four small kids) brough my in- laws for the first time and they stated this was the best vacation they have ever had. I would recommend Tribesman to anyone. They willl treat you just like you are one of the famly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: cancunbeach08
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Tribesman. We stayed in the only one-bedroom cabin they offer. It was perfect for our small family. Since it was early in the season, the only pool we used was the indoor pool which was a nice size, good temperature and clean. We enjoyed watching the wildlife each day - we saw deer, ducks, geese (and goslings), many birds, squirrels and chipmunks. We loved the easy access to Silver Dollar City on the days we visited the park (a must see). It's an easy drive into Branson as well, for all the entertainment you could ask for. Don't miss the fish hatchery! All the resort staff were friendly and helpful, including the gentleman that let us back into our unit when we locked ourselves out while loading the car to go home (at 6:30 am). It's a great resort in a very nice location! This is where we will stay the next time we visit Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Tribesman Resort!”
Reviews.Author: 4KIDSMOM69
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay. We have rented the 4 bedroom Dutch Homes on 2 different occasions. The home is older, but is clean, and the spirial staircase is no big deal. There are also wooden stairs leading to the top floor outside the house. Behind the house is a path leading to the wonderful pool. Beautiful and clean. If you rent house #9 or #10, the pool will be right behind your house. This is a much better place to stay with kids than on the Branson Strip. The kids have more to do, swim, fish, boat, walk trails, and more. We also saved money by going to the Branson West Wal-Mart and buying food to cook. The kitchens are fully functional and there is a large kettel grill on the patio to grill. There is also a couple of clothes washers and dryers for you to use free of charge. (They were free when we were there.) Just bring your own soap. PS I think the Branson West Wal-Mart is only about 10 miles away. PPS If you set your dirty towels outside your front door every morning, they will replace them with clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Marlene_8
Reviews.Content: We had five couples in our family staying in one of the five bedroom houses with a spiral staircase. We are all ove 60yrs of age and had no problem with the stairs. The house was wonderful, tv great, and dishwasher worked. Clean towels every day. This was off season and we rented one of the pontoon boats. First two hours was free, extra two hours was 90.00. we stayed out only two hours and it cost only the price of a gallon of gas($4.00). All the staff there could not have been more helpful with directions and advise for shows. We did not have kids but I would most certainly bring my grand kids for the trails and fishing. the pools were great and the hot tubs even better. I got my moneys worth in this visit. I would recommend it to anybody. By the way we drove sixteen hours to get there, and arrive right at 430pm and checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip at the Tribesman Resort”
Reviews.Author: katytexasaggie
Reviews.Content: Our group of 18 stayed at the Tribesman Resort July 26-Aug 1st. My family of 6 was in the Timber Glen area. This area is very close to the lake and dock where you can fish. The staff are excellent at offering advice on fishing and what type bait has been working. The cabin itself was just okay. Nothing fancy, very very basic. We had a bbq pit outside which we took full advantage of almost daily. Towels and sheets are all mismatched and furnishings are very 70 ish. Washer and Dryer were a short walk from our cabin and were free. We were very close to Silver Dollar City (3 milies) which was nice. My only complaint was that my whole family got lots of bug bites. I got a terrible case of chiggers and had to see a Dr. for it. My children have some other type of bites that aren't chiggers but are all over there bodies. My daughter and another young relative each had seed ticks on there bodies. 4 out of 18 of us had to seek medical attention either while at the resort or shortly after we got back home because of the bites/ticks. Several of us wondered if any of the bug bites could be coming from the sheets on the bed. Other than all the bites we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: littlesisjen
Reviews.Content: I am a 25 year old that has been coming to the resort since I was five years old... I would definately reccommend this resorts to familys big or small. There are so many activities to keep a family occupied. The resort staff is more than friendly. They treat you like family... If you have problems... which we never have had the will address them right away... I love being close to the lake... we come with our jet skis... haveing a dock on property is a big plus... we stay here several times a year.... in fact i will be back Labor Day weekend.... Maybe even a weekend in August.... When I was little I used to stay for two weeks at a time.... Now that I am getting married and have grown we usually just stay for long weekends.. I can tell you that I always look forward to comeing back and staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Week- What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: jstl32
Reviews.Content: We just returned from The Tribesman, staying there from July 7-12, 2008. We had a good experience based on our modest expectations and being with extended family members that love the outdoors. The house we stayed in was okay; it probably hasn't been updated in 20 years but everything worked (a/c, dishwasher, washer/ dryer) and the staff was responsive to simple requests for things like towels or general information. It's definitely modestly appointed but worked fine for us to prepare food, eat, bathe and sleep; we did everything else outdoors. The staff also works to be family friendly, our children (age 6 and 4) enjoyed the kids fishing derby, swimming pools (including an indoor pool that came in handy when it rained) and the daily food socials. (e.g. Nacho Day and the Ice Cream Social) The lake was wonderful. A family member brought a fishing boat and we had some good luck fishing from 5:30 - 8:30 a.m. or so each morning. We also rented a pontoon boat from the resort one day and had a great time; the lake is beautiful and seems to be considerably less busy than The Lake of the Ozarks. We had a great time playing golf at Ledgestone, a super course that is nearby. The $75 greens fee was money well spent. We also enjoyed the cold beer and excellent burgers at The Lake House, a neat little pub nearby with a great view of the lake and very nice people. (The name of the place changed when the new owners took over 4-1-2008) If you are thinking about going consider expecting: - Functional rooms/ houses that are far from five star, but do the job - Very nice guests and staff (we met lots of people who have been going there for years) - Good access to the Lake, Silver Dollar City (we didn't go, but it's right up the road) and golf- a bit of a drive (20 minutes?) to the shows and main strip of tourist attractions

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could've stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Lindalu68
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Timber Ridge 1 bedroom apartment. It was very clean and we enjoyed the small water pond/waterfall outside of our balcony. I wish we could have stayed longer to take more advantage of the grounds and the kids' activities. The highlight is that we saw three deer outside near the indoor pool. I only have 2 complaints. 1) It would have been nice to have the ceiling fan in the bedroom instead of the living room. My son got cold sleeping in the living room on the pull out couch since the air conditioning unit is in the living room. We were a little warm in the bedroom since there wasn't an air unit or fan. It wasn't too terribly warm though. 2) I have to agree with previous reviewer that the arcade smelled a bit moldy. There could be some improvements as far as updating but overall we had a great time and will stay there again when we go back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: zonin0625
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Timber Top area. Rooms were dated which is fine but the smell of mold was very bad. Had to buy air fresheners. Staff was less than friendly. Our first morning there, there was no hot water. Went to the front desk and calmly asked if it was just our room or the whole resort and was rudely told "We'll take care of it". Pools were nice and hot tub was very nice. Play areas seem to be a bit misleading. The indoor child play area smelled horrible of mold. The 'playgrounds' consist of a climbing structure and two bouncing horses. It's decent for the price and would've been alot better were it not for the moldy smell.

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved staying at the Tribesman!”
Reviews.Author: overloaded
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our vacation in Branson,Mo where we stayed at the Tribesman Resort. Everyone in our family had a great time and the accommodations were excellent. Everything was exactly as advertised on their web site and that is saying a lot as it has not always been my experience with other cabins and resorts in the past. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was plenty to do for everyone in our family, from swimming to fishing to boating and all right there without having to leave the resort. The availability of golf carts to rent was an added treat to get around the grounds in. We look forward to returning next year and would recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice family oriented place!”
Reviews.Author: MtFujiko
Reviews.Content: Situated on the beautiful water of the Lake of Ozark with green hills around it this place is very close to the Silver Dollar City and less than 1hour drive to downtown Branson. Every time we stayed here for last several years we did boating, hiking in the woods and also enjoyed the Silver Dollor City or the shows in Branson. Their cottages ara nice and clean and well equipped with good privacy setting. The staff is very nice and helpful to make our stay enjoyable. They have children's programs that keep our kids busy. We certainly will go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Tribesman Resort was great!”
Reviews.Author: luvmygrammar
Reviews.Content: The Tribeman Resort far exceeded our expectations for our recent family vacation. The family-owned vacation spot is very family oriented. The individual cabins at the Tribesman Resort are perfect for families with children. There are accommodations for families of all sizes, even ours which includes seven children. For the first time, we were able to stay in a cabin in which we were not falling over each other. The kitchens were stocked with dishes and cooking pans & utensils...something not all facilities include. The staff was very friendly, informative, and accommodated our requests. The indoor pool was clean (it was too late in the year for the outdoor pools), the children had a great time down by the water using the kayaks and peddle boats (very nominal extra fee for those), and the little children enjoyed the playroom. Everything was clean. The setting was very peaceful and we enjoyed watching the variety of wildlife. Many deer came out in the early morning and at dusk. We will be staying at the Tribesman Resort in the future. Our only regret is that we had not found it sooner. We highly recommend the Tribesman Resort!

Reviews.Title: “This is our Branson Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Maiseyjo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Tribesman several times over the past three years. Twice we have come down and stayed with another family. Our families each have two boys and we have always been treated very well. They really do try to cater to families. There is plenty to do to keep us occupied right there and we found we didn't go into Branson very much. (That saved us money right there!) If something is wrong they are quick to fix it or make it right. There are older parts of the resort and newer parts. I would like to seem them update the older units with some more comfortable newer furniture but just the way they are now, they are still clean and comfortable. We came last year for a family reunion and were in the newer units. Very nice! A little better view of the lake on that side of the resort too. The pools are great. The indoor pool is adequate. Not fancy but our boys had fun. One of the best perks for me is that they have laundry facilities on site. Some of the newer units have washers and dryers in the rooms but even in the older units there are facilites right there next to the room. So nice to be able to wash something if I needed to and to go home with clean laundry! The BEST thing about the Tribesman is the friendly service. They make us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kandykanesp
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Tribesman on may 31-june 4 2007. It was Awsome! My huband & 2 children (11&15) really had a good time with all the different activities each day of the week. The cottage we stayed in was very nice & clean and was cooled and waiting when we arrived. It was a 2 bedroom 2 bath, very nice. The kitchen was awsome saved a ton of money by cooking and grilling. Very relaxing and peaceful. Just a short drive to town when you are ready to do your shopping and sightseeing. Very nice, clean pools along with hottubs. Free laundry rooms (which was wonderful!!) the dock was nice. Scenery was great seen sveral deer and the ducks were cute. Staff was friendly and helpful. A very family friendly place to stay. My son really enjoyed eating the hotdogs with "aunt shirley" very nice lady.This is going to be a place we visit yearly. We have some wondrful memories thank-you Tribesman. Our original vacation spot was Texas & we decided to stay a little closer to home with gas prices being so high, I can honestly say it was the best decision made. This is highly recomended alot better than hotels..your not awaken early by housekeeping, more room and truley a better bang for you buck$$$$. The memories youmake here will be priceless. I hated for our vacation to end :) Please give them a try You wont be disappointed!! God bless~~~ , A very satisfied Tribesman guest from Clarksville Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “one of the best stays in branson”
Reviews.Author: dsbb
Reviews.Content: just a short distance from all the congestion of town, but very quite & peaceful. truly a family vacation, with a lot of fun for young childern. i've been in the ozarks all my life and i can say it actually brought back a piece of nature that i'd been taking for granted!!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: vivuts
Reviews.Content: 3 of us women were in branson for a convention. we stayed at the tribesman. let me tell you, the minute i walked in the service was excellent. i felt like taking off my shoes, it felt that comfortable. they even gave us a steak dinner, with the fixins, to grill outside. the room was clean and comfortable. felt like home . i will be coming back, we definitely recommend this resort....

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: swidelnacer
Reviews.Content: WOW, The tribesman resort is a great place to stay we had a wonderful time at the resort and will be coming back year after year.It is a nice place to get away from city life.The staff are very nice people and so helpful.All in all we have a great vaction.

Reviews.Title: “Sounded great online, but some problems with resort and personnel”
Reviews.Author: dorsalmo
Reviews.Content: I was excited to find a resort on Table Rock Lake that had an indoor pool (it's the only one I know of). They also listed lots of activities for kids and seemed very friendly on the phone. Our actual experience was less than we had hoped for, however. My family has been coming to the area for almost 50 years - averaging at least one visit every year. One of the reasons we enjoy returning is because of the friendliness of the locals. Lately (with kids) we've been staying in Branson to take advantage of the preponderance of indoor pools - allowing our kids to swim in all types of weather since we come during all four seasons. I've missed the days when I was a child that our family stayed on the lake and fished. We always had very friendly hosts at every resort at which we stayed. That was, unfortunately, not the case at the Tribesman. I suspect that the owners are the elderly people we encountered. They need to step down and retire - somewhere other than the resort. They are the most sour, unfriendly people we have ever encountered in the Table Rock / Branson area in all the years we've been coming. You'd think if people hated their job so much, they'd quit and/or hand it over to others. Unfortunately, the younger people to which they might be passing the business are not much better. In fact, there was only one employee that was friendly - a man we only knew as "D" who worked on the dock. Besides the sour faces and behavior, my mother was treated like she was stupid when she asked a question of the (younger) woman at the front desk. Also, a (younger) worker at the dock (not "D") treated me like I had never seen a boat before (I'm 40 years old and have been fishing since I was able to pick up a rod and reel). He also tried to tell me that fishing licenses cost something other than what I just paid online a few nights before - like I didn't know what I paid or something. The worst, though, was the unprofessional nature of a particular conversation my wife happened to overhear. My son and I were at the office reserving a boat. He is very active and talkative because of his ADHD (or whatever it is) and also just because of his nature. Anyway, he was mostly just being friendly with the woman at the front desk while we were setting up the boat. Apparently, after we left the office to head to the dock, she called down to the dock hand on her walkie-talkie to have him get the boat ready. Unbeknownst to her, my wife and other son were on the dock. My wife said she "warned" the dock hand that a boy with "special needs" was coming down and that he was acting crazy and constantly talking. After my son and I arrived, the dock hand, when he wasn't treating me like an idiot, was very rude to my son. Admittedly, my son was excited about going in the boat (like all boys his age) and was in the way as the man was explaining things. There was no reason for him to be that rude, however. There are other good and bad things about the resort, but the unprofessional, unfriendly nature of most of the employees really ruined our stay there. Regardless of the features it offers, we will not be returning to the Tribesman. For those of you still considering it, however, here are some other pluses and minuses: + five pools, one indoor + two boat docks + campfire with free food on Saturday nights + free boat rental special (seasonal) + free danishes and drinks on Sunday mornings - older rooms are musty (spraying with air freshener helps) - water is rusty/metallic smelling and tasting - they seem to have a lot of rules - with consequences To be fair, they do have newer (more expensive) units if you like, and the first two negatives would probably not be an issue in those units. The excessive number of rules and nature of the consequences of disobedience made us feel as though we had to be careful with everything we did or we'd get charged for it. I'm still waiting to hear if they're going to charge us because we didn't empty the trash can in the dumpster when we left. There are too many resorts close to Silver Dollar City and the lake to waste time with the Tribesman. The indoor pool is certainly not worth dealing with the personnel. Go elsewhere and enjoy some of that famous Ozark hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great Week”
Reviews.Author: nonametraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent a very relaxed 5 days at the Tribesman. The staff was friendly and helpful. The Osage Jail unit we stayed in was old but clean the Timber ridge unit the rest of the family stayed in was also an older unit. It was also clean and every thing worked in both units. The grounds are well kept, the hiking trails, while not long, are nice walks. We rented a 24' pontoon for a day, the boat ran just fine, no problems with the equipment. We got a very good explanation from the young man in the morning which got us off to a good start. The website photos and information is accurate, contrary to some other posts I have read about the Tribesman. Any doubts give them a call and ask. This resort is a comfortable family retreat providing a great getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sara R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tribesman Resort in July 2006. We had a 2 bdrm Apartment in the Timber Ridge Section. These are probably some of the older units. The place was clean, but did smell musty, which is probably because they are by the lake. The room had a De-humidifier to help with this. But with that running and the air conditioner, and the fans that were in the walls between the main room and the bedrooms (so that the cool air from window unit would go into bedrooms) made it very noisy. Plus there were people above us who had kids and you could hear them running back and forth. We're used to a lot of noise though in our house, so it didn't bother us too much. They have plenty of pools to choose from. Different activity going on each day and hiking trails. The staff was friendly and helpful. If we were to go back again someday I will have to make my reservations sooner so that we could get one of the stand alone Houses with central air. They look very big and roomy and newer.

Reviews.Title: “Like summer camp for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from vacation at the Tribesman. We had a wonderful time and absolutely no problems. We stayed in the one bedroom one bath cottage with a view of the lake. It wasn't fancy, but it was spotless, cozy and comfortable. It came equipped with all the kitchen stuff you could need. It also had a washer and dryer which was nice. When we first checked in my son and I went for walk to explore the resort and right away we saw three deer. My son is 3 and had never seen deer so up close and I was amazed how close we could get without them running off. You can tell they are really used to people. We saw all kinds of wildlife during our stay including raccoons, chipmunks, squirels, rabbits, and tons of deer. There were thunderstorms the first half of one day of our stay, but that didn't spoil our fun becuase Tribesman has an indoor heated pool. All the pools were very clean and in pretty settings. Every section has it's own pool so they were never crowded. They had trails and a few play ground areas. It's a great place for families with children. They had fun activities for kids and faces on the trees. My son loved trying to find the trees with the faces on them. It reminded me so much of the summer camp I used to go to when I was a kid. It's just has a very laid back, woodsy feel to it. I would definently recommend this place to anyone who had kids. If I was wanting a romantic trip just with the hubby I would probably choose somewhere a liitle more posh but for the whole family this place was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Place”
Reviews.Author: bdlewis2745
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Tribesman in early August and had a nice time. The cottage we had had a nice little pond out front and we could take a short walk to where our boat was moored. It had a woodsy feel, and our family (2 senior citizens, 2 in their 30's and 2 under 10) had a great time. The place was clean and had all we needed. The place was obvious older, but because of it's woodsiness, that is exactly what I was looking for. It had a cabin feel to it. I recommend the Tribesman for your next family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Terrific Tribesman Time”
Reviews.Author: stepho
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 glorious nights and 6 beautiful days at the Tribesman from August 10-15th with my family of 5 (one teenager and two youth: 14, 11 & 9) They loved the indoor and outdoor pools, we stayed in a 2 br 1 ba apartment that was very clean and the staff was very accomodating. They got us anything we asked for and they even showed my son and I how to play shuffleboard... it was a blast and he actually beat me bad.. then my husband showed up and won against out son... yeah.. .... The Tribesman is located so close to Silver Dollar City that we would go for a couple of hours and when it got busy we would leave and go back to the Tribesman and swim or eat. We have season passes to Silver Dollar City which allowed us to come and go freely, and we did thanks to the tribesmans location.. I can't imagine doing that if we were guests in downtown Branson... especially with the traffic there at times.. Thank you so much Tribesman for making our family vacation as special as it was. ... Can't wait to see you next year ... and get ready because we are bringing alot more family next time.... After we told them, they decided they are coming with us. Thanks Stephanie

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tribesman”
Reviews.Author: LYKC3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at The Tribesman and we were very pleased. The owners and staff were so nice, friendly and super helpful with everything. Our unit was very clean, comfortable..better than most cabins that I have stayed in the Branson area and others. The kitchen was adequate, even had a dishwasher! There were washing machines and dryers that were free close to our cabin. Each unit has a nice charcoal grill, table & chairs for outside too. We took our 2 small grandchildren and there were many things for them to do.. they had a ball. There are at least 3 swimming pools on the property, one is indoors. There are several small play areas for the kids. We rented rods (for .50/hr ) and let the fish eat our worms, took the paddleboat out for a spin, hiked on the trail, swam.. we had a blast! The tv has limited cable (didn't look for any jacks for DVD or game units) but we can stay home to watch tv or videos! We were able to get on the internet per dial up, but the resort asks you not to tie up their limited phone lines with the internet, so we only used it late at night just to check on business things (we did get a wireless signal from somewhere but our old lap top wouldn't take the wireless card we had brought.) It's only 3 miles from Silver Dollar City, 15 minutes into Branson. We were so delighted with our trip we are planning to return to The Tribesman in a few weeks for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Tribesman Adventure”
Reviews.Author: jutsie
Reviews.Content: Our family spent five wonderful days at Tribesman Resort on Indian Point in Branson, Missouri recently and would love to share our thoughts with those of you who may be looking for a place to take your children or grandchildren. Tribesman Resort is just the place! We were pleasantly suprpised to see that the website and brochures were very accurate and that our cabin was clean and well supplied to enable us to cookout most of our meals and not have to rely on restauants in the area. There is a Walmart Supercenter nearby and just the place to buy all the food and extras you may have forgotten. Another advantage is the 3 mile distance from Silver Dollar City and all its adventures! The resort has daily activites planned just for children and the staff treats each one with respect and love. The grounds are lovely and the docks a perfect place to spend a few hours to fish or feed the ducks! We enjoyed a morning on the paddle boats with our grandchildren! Larger boats are also available for a day on Tablerock Lake. There are also hiking trails for you to enjoy and easy enough for children to hike along, too! We hope to return to Tribesman Resort one day soon and highly recommend it to you.

HotelInfo.Name: Tribesman Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 416 Cave Lane, Branson, MO 65616
